examples.name: API Documentation to Interactive Explorer
examples.description: Generate comprehensive API documentation from codebase and create an interactive API explorer with live testing capabilities

epic1.name: API Documentation Generation
epic1.purpose: Extract API endpoints, parameters, and responses from codebase to create structured documentation

epic2.name: Interactive API Explorer
epic2.purpose: Build a web-based interface allowing users to browse and test API endpoints in real-time
deliverables: Code snippet generator for multiple languages

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Extract and structure API documentation from source code
Build interactive web interface for API exploration
Connect explorer to live API endpoints
Design intuitive user experience for API testing

examples.sampleOutput: A fully functional web application where developers can browse API endpoints, see request/response examples, test endpoints with custom parameters, and generate code snippets in Python, JavaScript, cURL, and other languages

examples.name: Technical Specification to User Guide
examples.description: Transform technical specifications into accessible, user-friendly guides with tutorials and examples

epic1.name: Technical Specification Writing
epic1.purpose: Document system architecture, features, and technical requirements in detailed specifications

epic2.name: User Guide Creation
epic2.purpose: Convert technical documentation into easy-to-follow user guides with step-by-step tutorials

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Draft comprehensive technical specifications
Convert technical content to user-friendly language
Create step-by-step tutorials and examples

examples.sampleOutput: A comprehensive user guide with clear sections: Quick Start, Feature Tutorials, Best Practices, and Troubleshooting. Each section includes screenshots, code examples, and practical tips for end users

examples.name: Architecture Documentation to Diagram Generation
examples.description: Document complex system architecture and automatically generate visual diagrams with interactive components

epic1.name: Architecture Documentation
epic1.purpose: Create comprehensive documentation of system architecture, components, and data flows

epic2.name: Interactive Diagram Generation
epic2.purpose: Transform architecture documentation into interactive, zoomable diagrams with component details

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Document system architecture and component relationships
Convert documentation to structured diagram formats
Create interactive diagram interface
Ensure diagram accuracy and completeness

examples.sampleOutput: A suite of interactive diagrams including system overview, component dependencies, data flows, and deployment architecture. Diagrams support zoom, click-to-expand details, and export to PNG/SVG formats

examples.name: Unit Test Suite to Integration Test Framework
examples.description: Build comprehensive unit tests for individual components, then create integration test framework for end-to-end workflows

epic1.name: Unit Test Suite Creation
epic1.purpose: Develop thorough unit tests for all modules, functions, and classes with high coverage
deliverables: Unit tests for all core modules

epic2.name: Integration Test Framework
epic2.purpose: Build framework for testing interactions between components and external services

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Write comprehensive unit tests for all components
Design and implement integration test scenarios
Set up test databases and mock services
Define test coverage requirements and validate results

useCases: Legacy code refactoring with safety net
examples.sampleOutput: A complete test suite with 250+ unit tests and 50+ integration tests, achieving 85% code coverage. Tests run in under 2 minutes and include detailed failure reports with stack traces and assertions

examples.name: Test Data Generator to E2E Test Scenarios
examples.description: Create sophisticated test data generation system, then build end-to-end test scenarios using realistic data

epic1.name: Test Data Generator
epic1.purpose: Build configurable system to generate realistic test data for various scenarios

epic2.name: E2E Test Scenarios
epic2.purpose: Develop comprehensive end-to-end test scenarios using generated realistic data

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Build flexible test data generation system
Create E2E test scenarios and automation
Design load testing scenarios with realistic data
Define realistic user journeys for testing

examples.sampleOutput: A test data generator that can create 10,000+ realistic user records with relationships (orders, addresses, payments) in seconds, plus 25 E2E test scenarios covering critical user journeys like registration, checkout, and account management

examples.name: CI Pipeline Setup to Deployment Automation
examples.description: Configure continuous integration pipeline with automated testing, then implement automated deployment to multiple environments

epic1.name: CI Pipeline Setup
epic1.purpose: Establish continuous integration pipeline with automated builds, tests, and quality checks

epic2.name: Deployment Automation
epic2.purpose: Automate deployment process to staging and production environments with rollback capabilities

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Configure CI/CD pipeline and automation
Define deployment strategies and rollback procedures
Set up deployment environments and networking
Implement security checks and secret management

examples.sampleOutput: A fully automated CI/CD pipeline that builds, tests, and deploys code changes within 10 minutes. Includes automated rollback, Slack notifications, and deployment to staging/production environments with zero downtime

examples.name: Container Configuration to Orchestration Setup
examples.description: Containerize application with Docker, then set up Kubernetes orchestration for scalability and high availability

epic1.name: Container Configuration
epic1.purpose: Containerize all application components with optimized Docker images and configurations

epic2.name: Orchestration Setup
epic2.purpose: Deploy containerized application to Kubernetes with auto-scaling and load balancing

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Create optimized Docker images and configurations
Design and implement K8s orchestration
Set up monitoring, logging, and alerting
Implement container security and network policies

examples.sampleOutput: A production-ready Kubernetes cluster running containerized application with 3 replicas per service, auto-scaling from 3-10 pods based on CPU usage, ingress with SSL termination, and centralized logging to ELK stack

examples.name: Data Ingestion Pipeline to ETL Transformation
examples.description: Build data ingestion pipeline from multiple sources, then implement ETL transformations for analytics

epic1.name: Data Ingestion Pipeline
epic1.purpose: Create robust pipeline to ingest data from APIs, databases, and file sources

epic2.name: ETL Transformation
epic2.purpose: Transform raw data into clean, structured format ready for analytics and reporting

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Build data ingestion and ETL pipelines
Design data warehouse schema
Define validation rules and quality checks
Create analytics-ready data models

examples.sampleOutput: A data pipeline processing 1M+ records daily from 5 sources (REST APIs, PostgreSQL, S3 files), transforming data through 15 ETL jobs, and loading into data warehouse with dimensional model ready for BI tools

examples.name: Data Validation Rules to Quality Dashboard
examples.description: Define comprehensive data validation rules, then create dashboard to monitor data quality metrics

epic1.name: Data Validation Rules
epic1.purpose: Establish validation rules and data quality constraints for all data sources

epic2.name: Quality Dashboard
epic2.purpose: Build visual dashboard to monitor data quality metrics and validation failures

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Define validation rules and quality metrics
Build interactive quality monitoring dashboard
Monitor data quality and handle exceptions

examples.sampleOutput: A real-time dashboard showing data quality scores (95%+), validation failure trends, top error types, and detailed drill-down into specific validation failures with sample records and remediation suggestions

examples.name: React Component Library to Storybook Documentation
examples.description: Develop reusable React component library, then create interactive Storybook documentation for developers

epic1.name: React Component Library
epic1.purpose: Build comprehensive library of reusable React components with consistent design system

epic2.name: Storybook Documentation
epic2.purpose: Create interactive documentation showcasing component variants, props, and usage examples

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Build component library with best practices
Ensure design consistency across components
Create comprehensive Storybook documentation
Ensure components meet WCAG standards

examples.sampleOutput: A component library with 25 production-ready React components (buttons, forms, modals, tables, etc.) and comprehensive Storybook with 100+ stories showing all variants, props, and usage patterns

examples.name: Landing Page Development to SEO Optimization
examples.description: Build responsive landing page with modern design, then optimize for search engines and performance

epic1.name: Landing Page Development
epic1.purpose: Create responsive, modern landing page with compelling content and call-to-actions

epic2.name: SEO Optimization
epic2.purpose: Optimize landing page for search engines, performance, and accessibility

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Build responsive landing page
Implement SEO best practices and metadata
Optimize page load time and Core Web Vitals

examples.sampleOutput: A fully responsive landing page loading in under 2 seconds with 95+ Lighthouse score, optimized meta tags, schema.org markup, and integrated with Google Analytics for conversion tracking

examples.name: Linting Configuration to Code Style Enforcement
examples.description: Configure code linting and formatting tools, then set up automated enforcement in development and CI

epic1.name: Linting Configuration
epic1.purpose: Set up ESLint, Prettier, and other linting tools with team-agreed code style rules

epic2.name: Code Style Enforcement
epic2.purpose: Automate code style enforcement through git hooks and CI pipeline checks

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Define code style standards and linting rules
Integrate linting into CI/CD pipeline
Document standards and help team adoption

examples.sampleOutput: A fully configured linting setup that automatically formats code on commit, prevents commits with linting errors, and fails CI builds with style violations. Includes detailed documentation for team members

examples.name: Code Review Automation to Refactoring Suggestions
examples.description: Automate code review checks with static analysis, then generate intelligent refactoring suggestions

epic1.name: Code Review Automation
epic1.purpose: Set up automated code review tools to catch bugs, security issues, and code smells

epic2.name: Refactoring Suggestions
epic2.purpose: Generate intelligent refactoring suggestions based on code analysis and best practices

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Configure automated code review tools
Define refactoring patterns and priorities
Customize analysis rules for codebase
Review and prioritize refactoring suggestions

examples.sampleOutput: An automated system that reviews every PR for 50+ quality metrics, posts inline comments on issues, and generates weekly refactoring reports identifying 20+ high-priority improvements with estimated effort

examples.name: Project Scaffolding to Configuration Management
examples.description: Generate project structure with best practices, then set up configuration management for multiple environments

epic1.name: Project Scaffolding
epic1.purpose: Create well-structured project template with best practices and conventions

epic2.name: Configuration Management
epic2.purpose: Set up environment-specific configuration management system

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Create project scaffolding and best practices
Design configuration management system
Implement secure secret management

examples.sampleOutput: A fully scaffolded project with organized directory structure, package management, ESLint/Prettier config, and environment-specific configuration files supporting development, staging, and production environments

examples.name: Database Schema Design to Migration Scripts
examples.description: Design normalized database schema with relationships, then create migration scripts for version control

epic1.name: Database Schema Design
epic1.purpose: Design comprehensive database schema with tables, relationships, and constraints

epic2.name: Migration Scripts
epic2.purpose: Create version-controlled migration scripts for schema deployment and updates

suggestedAgents.responsibility: Design optimal database schema
Create and test migration scripts
Ensure data integrity and relationships

examples.sampleOutput: A complete database schema with 15 tables, proper normalization, foreign key constraints, and 10 migration scripts covering initial setup, indexes, and seed data. Includes rollback scripts for all migrations
